discussion_comments.comment_body: These should be using theme based colors instead of hard coded colors.  This helps with accessibility for those that have trouble with colors.
I just attempted to add `aria-label="Copy Code"` to my branch. After installing it in VSCode and rendering Mermaid flowcharts, nothing changed. What am I missing?
aria-labels are for readability for people with visual impairments.  It will have no visual change for you.

discussion_comments.comment_body:
these particular lines were copy+pasted directly from how console logs was working. I forgot to mention that, I'm not sure if that's valuable or if I should remove it entirely.
I would definitely take a hand-hold with how accessibility has been viewed historically though if this is a big deal to the cline community, I don't have experience with that. I can add `aria-label="View HTML Content"` to the `div` that has the `onClick` listener if that feels appropriate.
